doc.title: repeatoire

description.text: Locating DNA repeats inside of sequenced genome

doc.authors: Todd Treangen, Aaron Darling and Eduardo PC Rocha
doc.reference: Todd J. Treangen, Aaron E. Darling, Guillaume Achaz, Mark A. Ragan, Xavier Messeguer, Eduardo P.C. Rocha, "A Novel Heuristic for Local Multiple Alignment of Interspersed DNA Repeats," IEEE/ACM Transactions on Computational Biology and Bioinformatics, vol. 6, no. 2, pp. 180-189

xhtml:div.label:
Seed weight?
Forms the foundation of the repeats families. Smaller values are more sensitive but allow for more noise (less specific), whereas larger values are less sensitive but more specific.

Only process seed matches on same strand?
Yes No
Often one wants to only analyze repeats in the same orientation. Else, program will include inverted repeats in the output.

Perform gapped extension?
Yes No
If gapped extension is disabled, output will be the local multiple alignments of the gapped chains.
Optimize for large repeats Yes No

Minimum final repeat length?
To increase specificity when wanting to focus on larger repeats, this option will only return repeat families containing repeats > value

Maximum repeat multiplicity?
Option to increase specificity. If one knows a priori that high copy repeats can be excluded from the analysis, this option can be used to discard all repeat families with more repeat copies than this specified value.

Minimum repeat multiplicity?
Similar to maxmulti, this option can be used to discard all repeat families that have fewer copies than this value.

Use solid/exact seeds?
Yes No
By default, the program uses palindromic spaces seed patterns to find seed matches inside of the input sequence. However, this can be turned off, which will use solid seed patterns (no mismatches in the seed matches allowed).
Allow redundant alignments Yes No
Require two hits for gapped extension Yes No
Chain seeds Yes No
XML format output Yes No

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Forms the foundation of the repeats families. Smaller values are more sensitive but allow for more noise (less specific), whereas larger values are less sensitive but more specific.
Often one wants to only analyze repeats in the same orientation. Else, program will include inverted repeats in the output.
If gapped extension is disabled, output will be the local multiple alignments of the gapped chains.
To increase specificity when wanting to focus on larger repeats, this option will only return repeat families containing repeats > value

Option to increase specificity. If one knows a priori that high copy repeats can be excluded from the analysis, this option can be used to discard all repeat families with more repeat copies than this specified value.
Similar to maxmulti, this option can be used to discard all repeat families that have fewer copies than this value.

By default, the program uses palindromic spaces seed patterns to find seed matches inside of the input sequence. However, this can be turned off, which will use solid seed patterns (no mismatches in the seed matches allowed).

format.code: ( "" , " --z=" + str(value))[ value is not None and value != vdef ]
